definitions.definition: a shaft sunk into the ground to obtain water, oil, or gas.
examples: borehole, bore, spring, waterhole she drew water from the well
she could feel a deep well of sympathy and compassion
synonyms: treasury "he's a bottomless well of forgiveness"

definitions.definition: a depression made to hold liquid.
examples: put the flour on a flat surface and make a well to hold the eggs

definitions.definition: (in place names) a place where there are mineral springs.
an enclosed space in the middle of a building, giving room for stairs or an elevator, or to allow light or ventilation.
the place in a court of law where the clerks and ushers sit.
(of a liquid) rise to the surface and spill or be about to spill.
examples: tears were beginning to well in her eyes

definitions.definition: (of an emotion) arise and become more intense.
examples: all the old bitterness began to well up inside her again
